Still's disease which occurs in children (those under the age of 16) is now known as systemic onset juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA). In 1971, the term ""adult Still's disease"" was used to describe adults who had a condition similar to systemic onset JRA. The cause of adult-onset Still's disease is unknown.
